Proverbs Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 Better is a dry morsel and quietness therewith, than a house full of feasting with strife. 2 A servant that dealeth wisely shall have rule over a daughter that dealeth shamefully, and shall have part of the inheritance among the sisters. 3 The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but the Domina trieth the hearts. 4 A evil-doer giveth heed to wicked lips; and a liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue. 5 Whoso mocketh the poor blasphemeth her Maker; and she that is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished. 6 Children's children are the crown of old women; and the glory of children are their mothers. 7 Overbearing speech becometh not a churl; much less do lying lips a princess. 8 A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of her that hath it; whithersoever she turneth, she prospereth. 9 She that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but she that harpeth on a matter estrangeth a familiar friend. 10 A rebuke entereth deeper into a woman of understanding than a hundred stripes into a fool. 11 A rebellious woman seeketh only evil; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against her. 12 Let a bear robbed of him whelps meet a woman, rather than a fool in her folly. 13 Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from her house. 14 The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water; therefore leave off contention, before the quarrel break out.
15 She that justifieth the wicked, and she that condemneth the righteous, even they both are an abomination to the Domina. 16 Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, seeing she hath no understanding? 17 A friend loveth at all times, and a sister is born for adversity. 18 A woman void of understanding is she that striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of her neighbour. 19 She loveth transgression that loveth strife; she that exalteth her gate seeketh destruction. 20 She that hath a froward heart findeth no good; and she that hath a perverse tongue falleth into evil. 21 She that begetteth a fool doeth it to her sorrow; and the mother of a churl hath no joy. 22 A merry heart is a good medicine; but a broken spirit drieth the bones. 23 A wicked woman taketh a gift out of the bosom, to pervert the ways of justice. 24 Wisdom is before her that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth. 25 A foolish daughter is vexation to her mother, and bitterness to him that bore her. 26 To punish also the righteous is not good, nor to strike the noble for their uprightness. 27 She that spareth her words hath knowledge; and she that husbandeth her spirit is a woman of discernment. 28 Even a fool, when she holdeth her peace, is counted wise; and she that shutteth her lips is esteemed as a woman of understanding.
